overview:
Minh Trinh works in research and technology. He has more than ten years of quantitative research and investment experience. He has worked as a portfolio manager at Neuberger Berman. He is a former senior vice president in fixed income research at Lehman Brothers. He was an economics teaching fellow at Harvard University (1994-1996).ï»¿ He started his career in the French civil service in the defense and energy sectors and served as a cadet naval officer on the aircraft carrier Foch (Marine Nationale) in the Medditerranean Sea.

He is a graduate of the Ecole Polytechnique, the University of Paris Dauphine and Harvard University where he earned a PhD in economics. He studied with Harvard Professor Oliver Hart and Professor Eric Maskin, 2007 Nobel Prize laureate.
